html:
This Week's #TakeOutTuesday is at Georgetown Butcher and Clyde's

Support the FINAL #GeorgetownTOT by ordering from Georgetown Butcher and Clyde's for lunch or dinner.

Al Dente Celebrates Easter

Al Dente celebrates Easter from 11:30 a.m to 8:30 p.m. with a three course prix-fixe menu for $39.95 per person.

Helene Schmitz Dreamland Photography March 25

Join the Virtual Grand Opening of “Dreamland”: Photography by Helene Schmitz presented by the Embassy of Sweden on Thursday, March 25, from 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm (ET).

James A. Baker III

“This is like Hollywood Squares,” quipped Steve Clemons, Editor-at-Large The Hill, as he welcomed 500 Zoom guests to a book party in honor of Peter Baker and Susan Glasser, authors of

Easter at Brasserie Liberté

Brasserie Liberté celebrates Easter with signature “Mimosa Kits,” which includes a bottle of sparkling wine and seasonal juices.

Kayaking + Fun April 25

Get together for Kayaking + Fun on April 25, 2021 from 4:30 to 7:30 pm at Key Bridge Boathouse, 3500 Water Street in Georgetown. Purchase tickets here.

This Week Make It La Jolie Bleue & El Centro for #TakeOutTuesday

For TakeOutTuesday this week, please order lunch or dinner from La Jolie Bleue and El Centro.

Georgetown's Got a Spring GLOW

Local and national artists will show five commissioned artworks during Spring GLOW in Georgetown, Friday, April 9 – Sunday, June 27, 2021.

Hugh Newell Jacobsen 1929-2021

The very first series of articles I wrote for The Dish were about him: A Walk with Hugh Newell Jacobsen and Lunch With Hugh Newell Jacobsen.

The Past and Future of the C&O Canal in Georgetown April 13

Join Tudor Place Executive Director Jeff Nichols and Director of Education & Partnerships Kelly Schindler, both of Georgetown Heritage, as they highlight the history of the C&O Canal and explore its connections to T

Fairmont's Easter Cookies Decorating Baskets To-Go

Just in time for Easter, Fairmont Washington, D.C., Georgetown is offering Easter Cookie Decorating Baskets To-Go with a percentage of the proceeds benefitting Horton’s Kids*.

Georgetown Does the Foxtrot

Foxtrot Market, co-founded by Mike LaVitola and Taylor Bloom, has opened in Georgetown.

#TakeOutTuesday at Susheria & Martin's Tavern March 2

On Tuesday, March 2nd please order take out for lunch or dinner from either Susheria or Martin’s Tavern.

WikiGap Challenge March 8

Join the fourth annual

East Banc Launches Retail Lab in Former Brooks Brothers Space

Concept 31/M, named for its location at the corner of 31st and M Street, is the conversion of Brooks Brothers by EastBanc Inc. into a retail lab concept to help local businesses struggling to remain open

The Magic of Spying With Peter Wood Feb. 28

Enjoy a family-frinedly afternoon Sunday, February 28, 2021 starting at 3:00 pm.

My Covid Experience

Before I was infected with Covid-19 last year, I was so sure I was not going to get this strain of Sars. I was incredibly careful and conscientious, but that changed in late December 2020, when flying back to DC from Zimbabwe from visiting my parents.

Make Your Own Bernie Mittens

If you, too, want mittens that vaguely resemble large ribeye steaks, look no further. Learn to knit Bernie Sanders'-style mittens with Shop Made in DC and Helen Fields, Feb. 28 from 3:00 pm - 5:00pm.

Brasserie Liberte and Los Cuates This #TakeOutTuesday

On Tuesday, February 23rd, we have selected Brasserie Liberte and Los Cuates for #TakeOutTuesday.

Second Covid Vaccination Completed

One week ago I received my second shot of the Moderna vaccine. It was twenty-eight days since my first one. It is difficult to say how much this has meant to my peace of mind. I now know within about two weeks from receiving the second dose I will be over 90% protected. Can I still get it?

Feb.19 Deadline to Nominate Georgetown Businesses for Grant

In Phase 2 of the Georgetown BID’s Employee Emergency Relief Grant program, employees in the Georgetown BID commercial district who have lost their jobs as a result of the coronavirus crisis may be eligible to receive a one-time grant of up to $300 to help with immediate and emer

Black Georgetown Community History Project: Family Archive Feb. 19

Explore Georgetown’s Black history and learn how to preserve your own family photographs, documents and more February 19, 2021 from 1:00 to 2:00 pm.

Economic Rebound Forecast for Greater Washington

According to a new regional economic forecast by the Stephen S.

'Lincoln: Divided We Stand'

“The biggest misconception of Lincoln is that he was perfect.”

#TakeOutTuesday at Kafe Leopold & City Sliders

This Tuesday, February 16th, please order take out from either Kafe Leopold or City Sliders. Lunch or Dinner!

Shakespeare Theatre's Mock Trial March 11

Each year the Shakespeare Theatre puts on a number of fun events. This year on Thursday, March 11, at 7:30 be prepared for a great evening with the Shakespeare Theatre’s 2021 Mock Trial. Supreme Court Justice Stephen G. Breyer will take the Bench.

CAG Celebrates Black History Month Feb. 16

To celebrate Black History Month, please join Citizens Association of Georgetown’s (CAG) February Meeting February 16, 2021 starting at 6:30 pm via Zoom.

Valentine's Day With Veronneau

Blues Alley hosts streaming jazz with Veronneau Monday, February 15, 2021.

Online Valentine's Day Art Tour

Join an online Live Virtual Valentine's Day Art Tour of National Gallery of Art, DC Collection Thursday, February 11, 2021 from 5:00 to 6:00 pm. This event is repeated on multiple dates.

This #TakeOutTuesday Make It Bistrot Lepic and Pizzeria Paradiso

This #TakeOutTuesday, February 9th, please choose from either Bistrot Lepic or Pizzeria Paradiso. Lunch or Dinner!

Addison/Ripley Presents John Borden Evans

Addison/Ripley Fine Art is pleased to present the paintings of John Borden Evans from February13 through March 27, 2021

Georgetown's Four Seasons Named #1 Hotel in DC

U.S.

Unsung Heroes: Spy Celebrates African Americans in Espionage

"Every shut eye ain't sleep," is an African American proverb that aptly addresses the presence and many contributions of African Americans in espionage.

Have an Ultra Violet Valentine's Day!

Designed by hand, delivered by hand (contact free), Fabio and his stellar team are ready to create that exquisite floral arrangement for your Valentine!

Tudor Nights: A Most Awful and Lamentable Tragedy Feb. 25

While observing the power of a new cannon called the “Peacemaker” aboard the naval vessel USS Princeton, Commodore Beverley Kennon, husband of Tudor Place’s Britannia Wellington Peter Kennon, was killed by an explosion of the weapon.

Georgetown's #TakeOutTuesday

Introducing Georgetown #TakeOutTuesday!

Pick Your Poison

Did you know that in the year 1800, the average American over the age of fifteen consumed thirty-two gallons of hard cider and beer, seven gallons of distilled spirits, and one gallon of wine?

Fairmont Valentine Boxes To-Go

On Friday, February 12th, Valentine’s Boxes To-Go will be available for pick-up at 4:00 pm in the Fairmont Washington D.C., Georgetown hotel driveway.

DC Restaurant Week Runs for Two Weeks

DC Winter Restaurant Week runs from January 25 through February 7, 2021.

During the extended two weeks, restaurants have a number of takeout and delivery options with to-go drink pairings.

Outdoor Exhibit at The REACH

Now through February 28, 2021, the Kennedy Center is reaching out around the globe to ask one question: in this period of unprecedented world challenges, how do we harness the healing power of art?

BID Seeks to Widen Georgetown Sidewalks

As reported by the

The Phillips Collection Celebrates Centennial

In 2021, The Phillips Collection, America’s first museum of modern art, celebrates its centennial with an exhibtion running February 20 through September 21, 2021.

'For There is Always Light'

With the exception of invited guests and an extraordinary military force, Washingtonians, the country and the world watched the Biden Harris Inauguration TOGETHER, albeit virtually.

Second Term For Our Marriage

Unlike President Trump, our marriage is getting a second term. But like the past four years, it hasn’t been without its challenges, particularly when it comes to politics. I’m a moderate Democrat. He’s a staunch Republican.

Ways to Watch the Inauguration

Tune in for the 59th Presidential Inauguration of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris on Wednesday, January 20 at bideninaugural.org/watch or on any of these social media channels:

What's Closed for the Inauguration

If you're not planning to watch the Inauguration of President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris on television, please be aware of what's closed in and around Washington DC.

National Mall and National Parks

Light at the End of the Tunnel

Distribution of the coronavirus vaccine is seen by most around the world as the light at the end of the tunnel. Being over 65 allowed me to register in DC to receive my first shot of the Moderna vaccine which I did on Friday morning.

Brasserie Liberté Open for MLK Day Brunch

Celebrate Martin Luther King Jr. Day on Monday January 18, 2021 at Brasserie Liberté!

WFP Lists Spectacular Georgian Home

Washington Fine Properties (WFP) is offering a spectacular Georgian-style home at 2829 Woodland Drive NW at $6,495,000.
